posts.post_content:
The very incarnation of an entire plane's mana? Damn, she must be the ultimate thing in the game. But no, wait, she was produced by the [Mirari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirari). Wow, the Mirari must be awesome! But the Mirari was made by [Karn, Silver Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn, Silver Golem). So I guess he's just the biggest cheese around. Except, he was made by Urza.  
  
Kind of puts things in perspective, doesn't it?

posts.post_content: [Vow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vow) of: take your pick, she's completely become a viable Commander; multiplayer she'll be smashing around the board, but always leaving you, her master, alone. Load up the deck with the multicolor tribe of your choice (I want to make an Avatar tribal deck), or just turn her into Voltron. The only danger becomes opponents with sacrifice effects who want her dead.

Posted By: Wprundv (9/14/2011 9:36:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
She HAD to have haste. If not, she would permanently be stuck in summoning sickness.   
  
Nobody would have had control of her since the beginning of their turn. Sort of like if you [mind control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mind control) something an opponent played the turn before, you can't attack with it until YOUR next turn. And if they [naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=naturalize) it on their turn, they have to wait once more. On Karona, it would never end as long as she kept getting passed around.  
  
Anyways, I like where they were going with her, but I think the fell short. Granted, creatures in her time weren't as flashy as they are today. But she needed more of a boost to hold that 'false idol' feel. Something to tempt players to try and take advantage of her, yet to be betrayed in the end. The tribal battle cry is nice and all, but falls short of "Break me!" especially with that mana cost. I know she was behind all of the insanely powerful [Decree](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Decree)s (Powerful, I didn't say mana efficient) but yet,... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: ZeroSheep (11/30/2011 11:44:14 PM)

posts.post_content:
Another fun cycle to throw in her EDH deck is the Dragon enchantments from Scourge:  
[Dragon Breath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Breath)  
[Dragon Fangs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Fangs)  
[Dragon Scales](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Scales)  
[Dragon Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Shadow)  
[Dragon Wings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Wings)  
  
Once you have all 5 in the yard, she enters and gains all of them, becoming a 9/8 Haste, Flying, Trample, Vigilance (will rarely matter though), Firebreathing, Fear creature that pumps a tribe by +3/+3 when it swings. Practical? Hell no. Cool to watch work out in casual? Of course. Just make sure you are able to deal with the mess you've made, since you'll be passing her around once the turn is over.  
  
Bonus point if you grab them all with [Conflux](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conflux) and give a long "by our powers combined" speech.

posts.post_content: "Let me explain the madness. Legions had two central iconic legendary creatures: Akroma and Phage. They essentially were the two villains of the story. And at the end of the Legions story they fight and end up merged as Karona. You know, the False God. (A quick aside – let me publicly apologize for Karona, False God. That card is an embarrassment to card design. I actually had zero to do with the card and I'm still embarrassed. We took two iconic beloved cool legends and combined them into a pile of, well a word I'm not allowed to use on this site. Of all the balls dropped with the design of legendary characters, this is one near the top of the list. My humblest apologies.)" – Mark Rosewater
posts.html:

And at the end of the Legions story they fight and end up merged as Karona. You know, the False God. (A quick aside – let me publicly apologize for Karona, False God. That card is an embarrassment to card design. I actually had zero to do with the card and I'm still embarrassed. We took two iconic beloved cool legends and combined them into a pile of, well a word I'm not allowed to use on this site. Of all the balls dropped with the design of legendary characters, this is one near the top of the list. My humblest apologies.)" – Mark Rosewater

Posted By: Agent1103 (8/6/2012 11:13:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is really cool. It's also a game winner. if not for you, your opponent. I imagine this would be most interesting in large multiplayer games however.  
  
My only real gripe with this card is that I personally feel like a being that came into existence due to [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) and [Phage the Untouchable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phage the Untouchable) should do something a bit more epic. That's just my opinion though, and I completely understand why they went with the '5 color chaos' feel.  
  
4/5 for flavor, concept, and art. Admittedly it's a card you have to build heavily around though.
posts.html:
This card is really cool. It's also a game winner. if not for you, your opponent. I imagine this would be most interesting in large multiplayer games however.

My only real gripe with this card is that I personally feel like a being that came into existence due to Akroma, Angel of Wrath and Phage the Untouchable should do something a bit more epic. That's just my opinion though, and I completely understand why they went with the '5 color chaos' feel.

4/5 for flavor, concept, and art. Admittedly it's a card you have to build heavily around though.

Posted By: BongRipper420 (6/4/2012 9:45:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
EDH, changeling and the vows ([Vow of Wildness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vow of Wildness)) have finally given this legend a place to call home. Keep in mind this is a decade after her printing. When she was released, she was gag-inducingly bad, and to add insult to pulling her as a rare, she is the culmination of the awesome [Phage the untouchable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phage the untouchable) (Who does manage to be far worse in EDH I suppose) and [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath).So following two blocks of awe-inspiring legends that did new things and pushed the boundaries of what a beatdown creature could be we got this.   
  
Thats right folks, you run five colors, you pay six mana and what do you get? a five five and a decent boost to your creatures, followed by your opponent getting the same devastating boost should they survive. A very dissapointing end to my favorite magic story of all time.
posts.html:
EDH, changeling and the vows (Vow of Wildness) have finally given this legend a place to call home. Keep in mind this is a decade after her printing. When she was released, she was gag-inducingly bad, and to add insult to pulling her as a rare, she is the culmination of the awesome Phage the untouchable (Who does manage to be far worse in EDH I suppose) and Akroma, Angel of Wrath.So following two blocks of awe-inspiring legends that did new things and pushed the boundaries of what a beatdown creature could be we got this.

Thats right folks, you run five colors, you pay six mana and what do you get? a five five and a decent boost to your creatures, followed by your opponent getting the same devastating boost should they survive. A very dissapointing end to my favorite magic story of all time.
